title: Freedmen's Bureau Records: Thomas Wholey to W. S. James, January 10, 1866
summary: Wholey writes to the War Department about property of his in Staunton that was seized first by the Confederate Army, and then by the Union Army. The lot was since turned over the to Freedmen's Bureau, and Wholey requests the return of the lot and compensation for lumber he stored on the property.
keywords: Military Authority, Patriotism, Property, American Civil War
